intro: Quinquina palton, commonly known as the golden root, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and can reach heights of up to two meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branched. The plant is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
